Introspection.name: open_paren
Introspection.description: Drawing Introspection makes my drawing of patterns act differently, for a time. Until I draw Retrospection, the patterns I draw are saved. Then, when I draw Retrospection, they are added to the stack as a list iota.

Retrospection.name: close_paren
Retrospection.description: If I draw another Introspection, it'll still be saved to the list, but I'll then have to draw two Retrospections to get back to normal casting.

Consideration.name: escape
Consideration.description: To use Consideration, I draw it, then another arbitrary pattern. That second pattern is added to the stack.

Numerical Reflection.name: number
Numerical Reflection.description: Irritatingly, there is no easy way to draw numbers. Here is the method Nature deigned to give us.

Bookkeeper's Gambit.name: mask
Bookkeeper's Gambit.description: An infinite family of actions that keep or remove elements at the top of the stack based on the sequence of dips and lines.

Mind's Reflection.name: get_caster
Mind's Reflection.description: Adds me, the caster, to the stack.

Compass' Purification.name: entity_pos/eye
Compass' Purification.description: Transforms an entity on the stack into the position of its eyes. I should probably use this on myself.

Compass' Purification II.name: entity_pos/foot
Compass' Purification II.description: Transforms an entity on the stack into the position it is standing. I should probably use this on other entities.

Alidade's Purification.name: get_entity_look
Alidade's Purification.description: Transforms an entity on the stack into the direction it's looking in, as a unit vector.

Stadiometer's Purification.name: get_entity_height
Stadiometer's Purification.description: Transforms an entity on the stack into its height.

Pace Purification.name: get_entity_velocity
Pace Purification.description: Transforms an entity on the stack into the direction in which it's moving, with the speed of that movement as that direction's magnitude.

Archer's Distillation.name: raycast
Archer's Distillation.description: Combines two vectors (a position and a direction) into the answer to the question: If I stood at the position and looked in the direction, what block would I be looking at? Costs a negligible amount of media.

Architect's Distillation.name: raycast/axis
Architect's Distillation.description: Like Archer's Distillation, but instead returns a vector representing the answer to the question: Which side of the block am I looking at? Costs a negligible amount of media.

Scout's Distillation.name: raycast/entity
Scout's Distillation.description: Like Archer's Distillation, but instead returns the entity I am looking at. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Waystone Reflection.name: circle/impetus_pos
Waystone Reflection.description: Returns the position of the Impetus of this spell circle.

Lodestone Reflection.name: circle/impetus_dir
Lodestone Reflection.description: Returns the direction the Impetus of this spell circle is facing as a unit vector.

Lesser Fold Reflection.name: circle/bounds/min
Lesser Fold Reflection.description: Returns the position of the lower-north-west corner of the bounds of this spell circle.

Greater Fold Reflection.name: circle/bounds/max
Greater Fold Reflection.description: Returns the position of the upper-south-east corner of the bounds of this spell circle.

Jester's Gambit.name: swap
Jester's Gambit.description: Swaps the top two iotas of the stack.

Rotation Gambit.name: rotate
Rotation Gambit.args: any, any, any → any, any, any
Rotation Gambit.description: Yanks the iota third from the top of the stack to the top. [0, 1, 2] becomes [1, 2, 0].

Rotation Gambit II.name: rotate_reverse
Rotation Gambit II.args: any, any, any → any, any, any
Rotation Gambit II.description: Yanks the top iota to the third position. [0, 1, 2] becomes [2, 0, 1].

Gemini Decomposition.name: duplicate
Gemini Decomposition.description: Duplicates the top iota of the stack.

Prospector's Gambit.name: over
Prospector's Gambit.description: Copy the second-to-last iota of the stack to the top. [0, 1] becomes [0, 1, 0].

Undertaker's Gambit.name: tuck
Undertaker's Gambit.description: Copy the top iota of the stack, then put it under the second iota. [0, 1] becomes [1, 0, 1].

Dioscuri Gambit.name: 2dup
Dioscuri Gambit.args: any, any → any, any, any, any
Dioscuri Gambit.description: Copy the top two iotas of the stack. [0, 1] becomes [0, 1, 0, 1].

Flock's Reflection.name: stack_len
Flock's Reflection.description: Pushes the size of the stack as a number to the top of the stack. (For example, a stack of [0, 1] will become [0, 1, 2].)

Gemini Gambit.name: duplicate_n
Gemini Gambit.description: Removes the number at the top of the stack, then copies the top iota of the stack that number of times. (A count of 2 results in two of the iota on the stack, not three.)

Fisherman's Gambit.name: fisherman
Fisherman's Gambit.description: Grabs the element in the stack indexed by the number and brings it to the top.

Fisherman's Gambit II.name: fisherman/copy
Fisherman's Gambit II.description: Like Fisherman's Gambit, but instead of moving the iota, copies it.

Swindler's Gambit.name: swizzle
Swindler's Gambit.description: Rearranges the top elements of the stack based on the given numerical code, which is the index of the permutation wanted.

Multiplicative Distillation.name: mul_dot
Multiplicative Distillation.description: Perform multiplication or the dot product.

Division Distillation.name: div_cross
Division Distillation.description: Perform division or the cross product.

Length Purification.name: abs_len
Length Purification.description: Compute the absolute value or length.

Floor Purification.name: floor
Floor Purification.description: "Floors" a number, cutting off the fractional component and leaving an integer value.

Ceiling Purification.name: ceil
Ceiling Purification.description: "Ceilings" a number, raising it to the next integer value if it has a fractional component.

Vector Exaltation.name: construct_vec
Vector Exaltation.description: Combine three numbers at the top of the stack into a vector's X, Y, and Z components (top to bottom).

Vector Disintegration.name: deconstruct_vec
Vector Disintegration.description: Split a vector into its X, Y, and Z components (top to bottom).

Axial Purification.name: coerce_axial
Axial Purification.description: Coerces a vector to its nearest axial direction, a unit vector. The zero vector is unaffected.

Conjunction Distillation.name: and
Conjunction Distillation.description: Returns True if both arguments are true; otherwise returns False.

Disjunction Distillation.name: or
Disjunction Distillation.description: Returns True if at least one of the arguments are True; otherwise returns False.

Exclusion Distillation.name: xor
Exclusion Distillation.description: Returns True if exactly one of the arguments is true; otherwise returns False.

Maximus Distillation.name: greater
Maximus Distillation.description: If the first argument is greater than the second, return True. Otherwise, return False.

Minimus Distillation.name: less
Minimus Distillation.description: If the first argument is less than the second, return True. Otherwise, return False.

Maximus Distillation II.name: greater_eq
Maximus Distillation II.description: If the first argument is greater than or equal to the second, return True. Otherwise, return False.

Minimus Distillation II.name: less_eq
Minimus Distillation II.description: If the first argument is less than or equal to the second, return True. Otherwise, return False.

Equality Distillation.name: equals
Equality Distillation.description: If the first argument equals the second (within a small tolerance), return True. Otherwise, return False.

Inequality Distillation.name: not_equals
Inequality Distillation.description: If the first argument does not equal the second (outside a small tolerance), return True. Otherwise, return False.

Negation Purification.name: not
Negation Purification.description: If the argument is True, return False; if it is False, return True.

Augur's Purification.name: bool_coerce
Augur's Purification.description: Convert an argument to a boolean. The number 0, Null, and the empty list become False; everything else becomes True.

Augur's Exaltation.name: if
Augur's Exaltation.description: If the first argument is True, keeps the second and discards the third; otherwise discards the second and keeps the third.

Entropy Reflection.name: random
Entropy Reflection.description: Creates a random number between 0 and 1.

Sine Purification.name: sin
Sine Purification.description: Takes the sine of an angle in radians, yielding the vertical component of that angle drawn on a unit circle. Related to the values of Ï€ and Ï„.

Cosine Purification.name: cos
Cosine Purification.description: Takes the cosine of an angle in radians, yielding the horizontal component of that angle drawn on a unit circle. Related to the values of Ï€ and Ï„.

Tangent Purification.name: tan
Tangent Purification.description: Takes the tangent of an angle in radians, yielding the slope of that angle drawn on a circle. Related to the values of Ï€ and Ï„.

Inverse Sine Purification.name: arcsin
Inverse Sine Purification.description: Takes the inverse sine of a value with absolute value 1 or less, yielding the angle whose sine is that value. Related to the values of Ï€ and Ï„.

Inverse Cosine Purification.name: arccos
Inverse Cosine Purification.description: Takes the inverse cosine of a value with absolute value 1 or less, yielding the angle whose cosine is that value. Related to the values of Ï€ and Ï„.

Inverse Tangent Purification.name: arctan
Inverse Tangent Purification.description: Takes the inverse tangent of a value, yielding the angle whose tangent is that value. Related to the values of Ï€ and Ï„.

Logarithmic Distillation.name: logarithm
Logarithmic Distillation.description: Removes the number at the top of the stack, then takes the logarithm of the number at the top using the other number as its base. Related to the value of e.

Modulus Distillation.name: modulo
Modulus Distillation.description: Takes the modulus of two numbers. This is the amount remaining after division - for example, 5 % 2 is 1, and 5 % 3 is 2.

Intersection Distillation.name: and_bit
Intersection Distillation.description: Takes the intersection of two sets.

Exclusionary Distillation.name: xor_bit
Exclusionary Distillation.description: Takes the exclusive disjunction of two sets.

Inversion Purification.name: not_bit
Inversion Purification.description: Takes the inversion of a bitset, changing all "on" bits to "off" and vice versa. In my experience, this will take the form of that number negated and decreased by one. For example, 0 will become -1, and -100 will become 99.

Uniqueness Purification.name: to_set
Uniqueness Purification.description: Removes duplicate entries from a list.

Reveal.name: print
Reveal.description: Displays the top iota of the stack to me.

Explosion.name: explode
Explosion.description: Remove a number and vector from the stack, then create an explosion at the given location with the given power.

Fireball.name: explode/fire
Fireball.description: Remove a number and vector from the stack, then create a fiery explosion at the given location with the given power.

Impulse.name: add_motion
Impulse.description: Remove an entity and direction from the stack, then give a shove to the given entity in the given direction. The strength of the impulse is determined by the length of the vector. Costs units of Amethyst Dust equal to the square of the length of the vector, plus one for every Impulse except the first targeting an entity.

Blink.name: blink
Blink.description: Remove an entity and length from the stack, then teleport the given entity along its look vector by the given length. Costs about one Amethyst Shard per two blocks travelled.

Break Block.name: break_block
Break Block.description: Remove a location from the stack, then break the block at the given location. This spell can break nearly anything a Diamond Pickaxe can break. Costs a bit more than one Amethyst Dust.

Place Block.name: place_block
Place Block.description: Remove a location from the stack, then pick a block item and place it at the given location. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Internalize Pigment.name: colorize
Internalize Pigment.description: I must be holding a Pigment in my other hand to cast this spell. When I do, it will consume the dye and permanently change my mind's coloration (at least, until I cast the spell again). Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Create Water.name: create_water
Create Water.description: Summon a block of water (or insert up to a bucket's worth) into a block at the given position. Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Destroy Liquid.name: destroy_water
Destroy Liquid.description: Drains either a liquid container at, or a body of liquid around, the given position. Costs about two Charged Amethyst.

Ignite Block.name: ignite
Ignite Block.description: Start a fire on top of the given location, as if a Fire Charge was applied. Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Extinguish Area.name: extinguish
Extinguish Area.description: Extinguish blocks in a large area. Costs about six Amethyst Dust.

Conjure Block.name: conjure_block
Conjure Block.description: Conjure an ethereal, but solid, block that sparkles with my pigment at the given position. Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Conjure Light.name: conjure_light
Conjure Light.description: Conjure a magical light that softly glows with my pigment at the given position. Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Overgrow.name: bonemeal
Overgrow.description: Encourage a plant or sapling at the target position to grow, as if Bonemeal was applied. Costs a bit more than one Amethyst Dust.

Recharge Item.name: recharge
Recharge Item.description: Recharge a media-containing item in my other hand. Costs about one Amethyst Shard.

Erase Item.name: erase
Erase Item.description: Clear a Hex-containing item in my other hand. Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Edify Sapling.name: edify
Edify Sapling.description: Forcibly infuse media into the sapling at the target position, causing it to grow into an Edified Tree. Costs about one Charged Amethyst.

Make Note.name: beep
Make Note.description: Remove a vector and two numbers from the stack. Plays an instrument defined by the first number at the given location, with a note defined by the second number. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Craft Phial.name: craft/battery
Craft Phial.description: Infuse a bottle with media to form a Phial.

White Sun's Nadir.name: potion/weakness
White Sun's Nadir.description: Inflicts weakness. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per 10 seconds.

Blue Sun's Nadir.name: potion/levitation
Blue Sun's Nadir.description: Inflicts levitation. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per 5 seconds.

Black Sun's Nadir.name: potion/wither
Black Sun's Nadir.description: Inflicts withering. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per second.

Red Sun's Nadir.name: potion/poison
Red Sun's Nadir.description: Inflicts poison. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per 3 seconds.

Green Sun's Nadir.name: potion/slowness
Green Sun's Nadir.description: Inflicts slowness. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per 5 seconds.

White Sun's Zenith.name: potion/regeneration
White Sun's Zenith.description: Bestows regeneration. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per second.

Blue Sun's Zenith.name: potion/night_vision
Blue Sun's Zenith.description: Bestows night vision. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per 5 seconds.

Black Sun's Zenith.name: potion/absorption
Black Sun's Zenith.description: Bestows absorption. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per second.

Red Sun's Zenith.name: potion/haste
Red Sun's Zenith.description: Bestows haste. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per 3 seconds.

Green Sun's Zenith.name: potion/strength
Green Sun's Zenith.description: Bestows strength. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per 3 seconds.

Summon Sentinel.name: sentinel/create
Summon Sentinel.description: Summons my sentinel at the given position. Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Banish Sentinel.name: sentinel/destroy
Banish Sentinel.description: Banish my sentinel, and remove it from the world. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Locate Sentinel.name: sentinel/get_pos
Locate Sentinel.description: Add the position of my sentinel to the stack, or Null if it isn't summoned. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Wayfind Sentinel.name: sentinel/wayfind
Wayfind Sentinel.description: Transform the position vector on the top of the stack into a unit vector pointing from that position to my sentinel, or Null if it isn't summoned. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Summon Lightning.name: lightning
Summon Lightning.description: I command the heavens! This spell will summon a bolt of lightning to strike the earth where I direct it. Costs about three Amethyst Shards.

Flight.name: flight
Flight.description: The power of flight! I have wrestled Nature to its knees. But Nature is vengeful, and itches for me to break its contract so it may break my shins.

Create Lava.name: create_lava
Create Lava.description: Summon a block of lava (or insert up to a bucket's worth) into a block at the given position. Costs about one Charged Amethyst.

Greater Teleport.name: teleport
Greater Teleport.description: Far more powerful than Blink, this spell lets me teleport nearly anywhere in the entire world! There does seem to be a limit, but it is much greater than the normal radius of influence I am used to.

Summon Greater Sentinel.name: sentinel/create/great
Summon Greater Sentinel.description: Summon a greater version of my Sentinel. Costs about two Amethyst Dust.

Dispel Rain.name: dispel_rain
Dispel Rain.description: A counterpart to summoning rain. This spell will dispel rain across the world I cast it upon. Costs about one Amethyst Shard. Does nothing if the skies are already clear.

Summon Rain.name: summon_rain
Summon Rain.description: I control the clouds! This spell will summon rain across the world I cast it upon. Costs about one Charged Amethyst. Does nothing if it is already raining.

Flay Mind.name: brainsweep
Flay Mind.description: I cannot make heads or tails of this spell... To be honest, I'm not sure I want to know what it does.

Akasha's Distillation.name: akashic/read
Akasha's Distillation.description: Read the iota associated with the given pattern out of the Akashic Library with its Record at the given position. This has no range limit. Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Akasha's Gambit.name: akashic/write
Akasha's Gambit.description: Associate the iota with the given pattern in the Akashic Library with its Record at the given position. This does have a range limit. Costs about one Amethyst Dust.

Hermes' Gambit.name: eval
Hermes' Gambit.description: Remove a pattern or list of patterns from the stack, then cast them as if I had drawn them myself with my Staff (until a Charon's Gambit is encountered). If an iota is escaped with Consideration or its ilk, it will be pushed to the stack. Otherwise, non-patterns will fail.

Charon's Gambit.name: halt
Charon's Gambit.description: This pattern forcibly halts a Hex. This is mostly useless on its own, as I could simply just stop writing patterns, or put down my staff.

Scribe's Reflection.name: read
Scribe's Reflection.description: Copy the iota stored in the item in my other hand and add it to the stack.

Chronicler's Purification.name: read/entity
Chronicler's Purification.description: Like Scribe's Reflection, but the iota is read out of an entity instead of my other hand.

Scribe's Gambit.name: write
Scribe's Gambit.description: Remove the top iota from the stack, and save it into the item in my other hand.

Chronicler's Gambit.name: write/entity
Chronicler's Gambit.description: Like Scribe's Gambit, but the iota is written to an entity instead of my other hand.Interestingly enough, it looks like I cannot write my own Name using this spell. I get a sense that I might be endangered if I could.

Auditor's Reflection.name: readable
Auditor's Reflection.description: If the item in my other hand holds an iota I can read, returns True. Otherwise, returns False.

Auditor's Purification.name: readable/entity
Auditor's Purification.description: Like Auditor's Reflection, but the readability of an entity is checked instead of my other hand.

Assessor's Reflection.name: writable
Assessor's Reflection.description: If I could save an iota into the item in my other hand, returns True. Otherwise, returns False.

Assessor's Purification.name: writable/entity
Assessor's Purification.description: Like Assessor's Reflection, but the writability of an entity is checked instead of my other hand.

Muninn's Reflection.name: read/local
Muninn's Reflection.description: Copy the iota out of my ravenmind, which I likely just wrote with Huginn's Gambit.

Huginn's Gambit.name: write/local
Huginn's Gambit.description: Removes the top iota from the stack, and saves it to my ravenmind, storing it there until I stop casting the Hex.

Nullary Reflection.name: const/null
Nullary Reflection.description: Adds the Null influence to the top of the stack.

True Reflection.name: const/true
True Reflection.description: Adds True to the top of the stack.

False Reflection.name: const/false
False Reflection.description: Adds False to the top of the stack.

Vector Reflection +X.name: const/vec/px
Vector Reflection +X.description: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [1, 0, 0] to the stack; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [-1, 0, 0].

Vector Reflection +Y.name: const/vec/py
Vector Reflection +Y.description: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [0, 1, 0] to the stack; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [0, -1, 0].

Vector Reflection +Z.name: const/vec/pz
Vector Reflection +Z.description: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [0, 0, 1]; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [0, 0, -1].

Vector Reflection -X.name: const/vec/nx
Vector Reflection -X.description: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [1, 0, 0] to the stack; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [-1, 0, 0].

Vector Reflection -Y.name: const/vec/ny
Vector Reflection -Y.description: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [0, 1, 0] to the stack; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [0, -1, 0].

Vector Reflection -Z.name: const/vec/nz
Vector Reflection -Z.description: The left-hand counter-clockwise pattern adds [0, 0, 1]; the right-hand clockwise pattern adds [0, 0, -1].

Arc's Reflection.name: const/double/pi
Arc's Reflection.description: Adds Ï€, the radial representation of half a circle, to the stack.

Circle's Reflection.name: const/double/tau
Circle's Reflection.description: Adds Ï„, the radial representation of a complete circle, to the stack.

Euler's Reflection.name: const/double/e
Euler's Reflection.description: Adds e, the base of natural logarithms, to the stack.

Entity Purification.name: get_entity
Entity Purification.description: Transform the position on the stack into the entity at that location (or Null if there isn't one).

Entity Purification: Animal.name: get_entity/animal
Entity Purification: Animal.description: Transform the position on the stack into the animal at that location (or Null if there isn't one).

Entity Purification: Monster.name: get_entity/monster
Entity Purification: Monster.description: Transform the position on the stack into the monster at that location (or Null if there isn't one).

Entity Purification: Item.name: get_entity/item
Entity Purification: Item.description: Transform the position on the stack into the dropped item at that location (or Null if there isn't one).

Entity Purification: Player.name: get_entity/player
Entity Purification: Player.description: Transform the position on the stack into the player at that location (or Null if there isn't one).

Entity Purification: Living.name: get_entity/living
Entity Purification: Living.description: Transform the position on the stack into the living creature at that location (or Null if there isn't one).

Zone Distillation: Any.name: zone_entity
Zone Distillation: Any.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of all entities near the position.

Zone Distillation: Animal.name: zone_entity/animal
Zone Distillation: Animal.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of animals near the position.

Zone Distillation: Non-Animal.name: zone_entity/not_animal
Zone Distillation: Non-Animal.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-animal entities near the position.

Zone Distillation: Monster.name: zone_entity/monster
Zone Distillation: Monster.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of monsters near the position.

Zone Distillation: Non-Monster.name: zone_entity/not_monster
Zone Distillation: Non-Monster.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-monster entities near the position.

Zone Distillation: Item.name: zone_entity/item
Zone Distillation: Item.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of dropped items near the position.

Zone Distillation: Non-Item.name: zone_entity/not_item
Zone Distillation: Non-Item.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-dropped-item entities near the position.

Zone Distillation: Player.name: zone_entity/player
Zone Distillation: Player.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of players near the position.

Zone Distillation: Non-Player.name: zone_entity/not_player
Zone Distillation: Non-Player.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-player characters near the position.

Zone Distillation: Living.name: zone_entity/living
Zone Distillation: Living.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of living creatures near the position.

Zone Distillation: Non-Living.name: zone_entity/not_living
Zone Distillation: Non-Living.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-living entities near the position.

Integration Distillation.name: append
Integration Distillation.description: Remove the top of the stack, then add it to the end of the list at the top of the stack.

Combination Distillation.name: concat
Combination Distillation.description: Remove the list at the top of the stack, then add all its elements to the end of the list at the top of the stack.

Selection Distillation.name: index
Selection Distillation.description: Remove the number at the top of the stack, then replace the list at the top with the nth element of that list (where n is the number you removed). Replaces the list with Null if the number is out of bounds.

Thoth's Gambit.name: for_each
Thoth's Gambit.description: Remove a list of patterns and a list from the stack, then cast the given pattern over each element of the second list.

Abacus Purification.name: list_size
Abacus Purification.description: Remove the list at the top of the stack, then push the number of elements in the list to the stack.

Single's Purification.name: singleton
Single's Purification.description: Remove the top of the stack, then push a list containing only that element.

Vacant Reflection.name: empty_list
Vacant Reflection.description: Push an empty list to the top of the stack.

Retrograde Purification.name: reverse_list
Retrograde Purification.description: Reverse the list at the top of the stack.

Flock's Gambit.name: last_n_list
Flock's Gambit.description: Remove num elements from the stack, then add them to a list at the top of the stack.

Flock's Disintegration.name: splat
Flock's Disintegration.description: Remove the list at the top of the stack, then push its contents to the stack.

Locator's Distillation.name: index_of
Locator's Distillation.description: Remove the iota at the top of the stack, then replace the list at the top with the first index of that iota within the list (starting from 0). Replaces the list with -1 if the iota doesn't exist in the list.

Excisor's Distillation.name: list_remove
Excisor's Distillation.description: Remove the number at the top of the stack, then remove the nth element of the list at the top of the stack (where n is the number you removed).

Selection Exaltation.name: slice
Selection Exaltation.description: Remove the two numbers at the top of the stack, then take a sublist of the list at the top of the stack between those indices, lower bound inclusive, upper bound exclusive. For example, the 0, 2 sublist of [0, 1, 2, 3, 4] would be [0, 1].

Surgeon's Exaltation.name: modify_in_place
Surgeon's Exaltation.description: Remove the top iota of the stack and the number at the top, then set the nth element of the list at the top of the stack to that iota (where n is the number you removed). Does nothing if the number is out of bounds.

Speaker's Distillation.name: construct
Speaker's Distillation.description: Remove the top iota, then add it as the first element to the list at the top of the stack.

Speaker's Decomposition.name: deconstruct
Speaker's Decomposition.description: Remove the first iota from the list at the top of the stack, then push that iota to the stack.

Gulliver's Purification.name: interop/pehkui/get
Gulliver's Purification.description: Get the scale of the entity, as a proportion of their normal size. For most entities, this will be 1.

Alter Scale.name: interop/pehkui/set
Alter Scale.description: Set the scale of the entity, passing in a proportion of their normal size. Costs about 1 Amethyst Shard.

Gravitational Purification.name: interop/gravity/get
Gravitational Purification.description: Get the main direction gravity pulls the given entity in, as a unit vector. For most entities, this will be down, <0, -1, 0>.

Alter Gravity.name: interop/gravity/set
Alter Gravity.description: Set the main direction gravity pulls the given entity in. The given vector will be coerced into the nearest axis, as per Axial Purification. Costs about one Charged Amethyst.

Sorter's Purification.name: type/block_item
Sorter's Purification.description: Remove a location, mote, item entity, or item frame from the stack, and adds the type of the block at that location, or type of that item, to the stack (e.g. Grass, Stone, Stick, etc.).

Physician's Purification.name: type/entity
Physician's Purification.description: Remove an entity from the stack, and adds the type of the entity at that location to the stack.

Classifier's Purification.name: type/iota
Classifier's Purification.description: Remove an iota from the stack, and adds the type of that iota to the stack.

Sorter's Reflection.name: type/item_held
Sorter's Reflection.description: Adds the type of the item in the caster's offhand to the stack if there is one present, or the type of the casting hand otherwise.

Entity Distillation: Type.name: get_entity/type
Entity Distillation: Type.description: Remove an entity type and a position from the stack, and returns an entity of that type at that position if one exists.

Zone Exaltation: Type.name: zone_entity/type
Zone Exaltation: Type.description: Remove an entity type, a position, and a radius from the stack, and returns a list of all entities of that type within that radius of that position.

Zone Exaltation: Not-Type.name: zone_entity/not_type
Zone Exaltation: Not-Type.description: Remove an entity type, a position, and a radius from the stack, and returns a list of all entities not of that type within that radius of that position

Timekeeper's Reflection.name: current_tick
Timekeeper's Reflection.description: Adds a number to the stack which seems to be related to how Nature represents time; If I cast the pattern, then cast the same pattern a second later, the number it adds has increased by 20.

Thanatos' Reflection.name: remaining_evals
Thanatos' Reflection.description: Adds the number of evaluations a hex is still capable of to the stack. This is reduced by Hermes' Gambit and Thoth's Gambit.

Diver's Purification.name: breath
Diver's Purification.description: Removes a Living entity from the stack and returns how much breath it has left (i.e., how close it is to drowning).

Nurse's Purification.name: health
Nurse's Purification.description: Removes a Living entity from the stack and returns how much health it has left (i.e., how close it is to dying).

Squire's Purification.name: armour
Squire's Purification.description: Removes a Living entity from the stack and returns how much armour it has.

Boxer's Purification.name: toughness
Boxer's Purification.description: Removes a Living entity from the stack and returns how much toughness it has (another property of armour).

Lamplighter's Purification.name: light_level
Lamplighter's Purification.description: Removes a position vector from the stack and returns the light level at that position.

Factorial Purification.name: factorial
Factorial Purification.description: Takes a number from the stack and computes its factorial, for example inputting 4 would return 4*3*2*1=24.

Running Sum Purification.name: running/sum
Running Sum Purification.description: Takes a list from the stack and computes its running sum, for example inputting [1,2,5] would return [1,3,8].

Running Product Purification.name: running/mul
Running Product Purification.description: Takes a list from the stack and computes its running product, for example inputting [1,2,5] would return [1,2,10].

Mnemosyne's Gambit.name: everbook/read
Mnemosyne's Gambit.description: Takes the position of an Akashic Record, as well as a Pattern as a key, and retrieves the iota at that key from your Everbook, storing it in the given Akashic Record if able.

Elysium's Gambit.name: everbook/write
Elysium's Gambit.description: Takes the position of an Akashic Record, as well as a Pattern as a key, and stores the iota in that record at that key to your Everbook at the same key.

Lethe's Gambit.name: everbook/delete
Lethe's Gambit.description: Takes a pattern and removes the entry with that pattern key from your Everbook.

Brigh's Gambit.name: everbook/toggle_macro
Brigh's Gambit.description: Takes a pattern and marks that entry of your Everbook as a Pattern that when drawn by your hand will be treated as any other of Nature's patterns.

Smelt.name: smelt
Smelt.description: Remove a location, item entity, or mote from the stack, then either smelt the block at the location or smelt all the items in the item entity or mote.

Freeze.name: freeze
Freeze.description: Freezes the block at a block location. For example, turns water into ice, and ice into packed ice. Costs one Amethyst Dust.

Falling Block.name: falling_block
Falling Block.description: Remove a location from the stack, and force the block there to fall as if it were sand or gravel. Costs one and a half Amethyst Dust.

Place Block II.name: place_type
Place Block II.description: Accepts an item type or mote and a location, and attempts to place a block of that item type at that location. If a mote was passed it will instead place from the record referenced by that mote. Costs an eighth of an Amethyst Dust.

Particles.name: particles
Particles.description: Accepts a location or a list of locations, and either creates a particle at the location, or creates lines of particles between the locations in the list. Costs two thousandths of an Amethyst Dust per location.

Summon Projectile Wisp.name: wisp/summon/projectile
Summon Projectile Wisp.description: This wisp is summoned and launched like an arrow, casting its hex on whatever it hits. The initial stack when it executes will be a reference to itself, then a reference to what it hit.

Summon Cyclic Wisp.name: wisp/summon/ticking
Summon Cyclic Wisp.description: Similar to Summon Projectile Wisp, but with only one vector input for the position to summon the wisp. Cyclic wisps are unmoving once summoned, instead executing their hex up to 20 times each second.

Identity Reflection.name: wisp/self
Identity Reflection.description: Add a reference to the casting wisp to the stack. This must be cast by a wisp; trying to cast it through a staff will fail rather spectacularly.

Reservoir Reflection.name: wisp/media
Reservoir Reflection.description: Add the amount of media in the wisp's reservoir to the stack. This must be cast by a wisp; trying to cast it through a staff will fail rather spectacularly.

Manager's Purification.name: wisp/hex
Manager's Purification.description: Removes a reference to a wisp from the stack, and replaces it with the wisp's contained hex. Must be a wisp you summoned, or a wisp that has allowed transfer with the caster or caster's owner.

Allegiance Distillation.name: wisp/owner
Allegiance Distillation.description: Removes a reference to a wisp and an entity from the stack, and returns true if that entity owns that wisp, and false otherwise.

Pathfinder's Gambit.name: wisp/move/target/set
Pathfinder's Gambit.description: Removes a position vector from the stack; The Cyclic Wisp that executed this pattern will move in a straight line towards that position (colliding with terrain in its path) until it reaches it.

Pathfinder's Reflection.name: wisp/move/target/get
Pathfinder's Reflection.description: Adds to the stack the position vector that the executing Cyclic Wisp is currently moving towards.

Haste.name: wisp/move/speed/set
Haste.description: Removes a number from the stack, and sets the executing Cyclic Wisp's maximum speed to that number.

Speedometer's Reflection.name: wisp/move/speed/get
Speedometer's Reflection.description: Gets the executing Cyclic Wisp's current maximum speed.

Allow Transfer.name: wisp/transfer/allow
Allow Transfer.description: When two wisps are linked together, they transfer media between each other until they are balanced. By default this only happens between wisps with the same owner. This takes an index, and explicitly allows the wisp to exchange media with the linkable at that index.

Disallow Transfer.name: wisp/transfer/disallow
Disallow Transfer.description: Correspondingly, this takes an index and disallows the wisp from exchanging media with the linkable at that index.

Allow Transfer Others.name: wisp/transfer/others/allow
Allow Transfer Others.description: This takes a wisp that you own and an index, and allows the wisp to exchange media with the linkable at that index.

Disallow Transfer Others.name: wisp/transfer/others/disallow
Disallow Transfer Others.description: This takes a wisp that you own and an index, and disallows the wisp from exchanging media with the linkable at that index.

Entity Purification: Wisp.name: get_entity/wisp
Entity Purification: Wisp.description: Transform the position on the stack into the wisp at that location (or Null if there isn't one).

Zone Distillation: Wisp.name: zone_entity/wisp
Zone Distillation: Wisp.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of wisps near the position.

Zone Distillation: Non-Wisp.name: zone_entity/not_wisp
Zone Distillation: Non-Wisp.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of non-wisp entities near the position.

Delay Wisp.name: wisp/trigger/tick
Delay Wisp.description: Removes an integer from the stack, then delays the wisp's next cast until at least that many twentieth's of a second have passed. This and other triggers like it will halve the wisp's upkeep cost while it isn't casting.

Listen.name: wisp/trigger/comm
Listen.description: The wisp's next cast will not occur until it has received at least one communication.

Wander.name: wisp/trigger/move
Wander.description: The wisp's next cast will not occur until it has reached the position it is navigating towards.

Familiar's Reflection.name: wisp/seon/get
Familiar's Reflection.description: Returns my currently bound wisp. A new wisp can only be bound when this returns null. (This is not a great spell, I have simply placed it here for convenience.)

Link.name: link
Link.description: Links the caster to the entity removed from the stack, which must be linkable. This costs one Amethyst Shard.

Link Others.name: link/others
Link Others.description: May be evaluated by any casting instrument. Links two entities, which must be linkable. This costs one Amethyst Shard.

Unlink.name: link/unlink
Unlink.description: Removes the link at the given index from the caster's links. This costs two Amethyst Dust.

Unlink Others.name: link/unlink/others
Unlink Others.description: Takes two linkables and unlinks them if they are linked. This costs two Amethyst Dust.

Phonebook Purification.name: link/get
Phonebook Purification.description: Removes an index from the stack, and adds the entity connected to the link at that index to the stack.

Recognition Purification.name: link/get_index
Recognition Purification.description: Removes an entity from the stack, and adds the index to the link to that entity to the stack (or -1 if the caster isn't linked to that entity).

Popularity Reflection.name: link/num
Popularity Reflection.description: Adds the number of links to the wisp to the stack.

Send Iota.name: link/comm/send
Send Iota.description: Removes an iota from the stack, then removes an index from the stack and sends the iota along the link at the given index.  This costs one hundredth of an Amethyst Dust.

Recitation Reflection.name: link/comm/read
Recitation Reflection.description: When something receives an iota along a link it is added to a queue. This pattern adds the first iota in the queue to the stack, removing it from the queue.

Postmaster's Reflection.name: link/comm/num
Postmaster's Reflection.description: Adds to the stack the number of unread iota in the caster's received iota queue.

Unclogging Gambit.name: link/comm/clear
Unclogging Gambit.description: Removes all unread iota from the caster's received iota queue.

Open Transmit.name: link/comm/open_transmit
Open Transmit.description: Similar to Introspection, until drawing a Close Transmit all patterns I draw are sent along the link whose index is at the top of the stack.

Close Transmit.name: link/comm/close_transmit
Close Transmit.description: When drawn after Open Transmit I stop transmitting drawn patterns. If either Open Transmit or Close Transmit are executed by an intermediary caster such as a wisp, they will mishap.

Gate's Opening.name: gate/mark
Gate's Opening.description: Consumes a gate iota and an entity. Marks that entity to be teleported the next time that gate is closed. Costs one twentieth of an Amethyst Dust.

Gate's Dismissal.name: gate/unmark
Gate's Dismissal.description: Consumes a gate iota and an entity. Unmarks that entity so that if it was marked with  Gate's Opening it will no longer be teleported the next time that gate is closed.

Marked Distillation.name: gate/mark/get
Marked Distillation.description: Consumes a gate iota and an entity, returns whether that entity is marked by that gate.

Marked Purification.name: gate/mark/num/get
Marked Purification.description: Consumes a gate iota, returns how many entities are marked by that gate.

Gate's Closing.name: gate/close
Gate's Closing.description: Consumes a non-drifing gate iota, or a drifting gate iota and a position. Transports all the entities marked with the passed gate to the stored or given position, as relevant. Costs half an Amethyst Shard, plus an Amethyst Dust per metre transported per entity, if the gate was drifting.

Bind Storage.name: mote/storage/bind
Bind Storage.description: Target a Mote Nexus block in the world and bind yourself to it, meaning all items you mediafy will be added to that nexus' capacity. Targeting any other block will unbind you from your currently bound nexus. Costs 32 Amethyst Dust.

Bind Storage - Temporary.name: mote/storage/bind/temp
Bind Storage - Temporary.description: Target a Mote Nexus block in the world and bind to it for the remainder of this cast, temporarily overriding your primary binding. Costs one thousandth of an Amethyst Dust.

Stocktake Reflection.name: mote/contained_type/get
Stocktake Reflection.description: Gets all the types of motes contained in the currently bound Mote Nexus.

Stocktake Purification.name: mote/contained/get
Stocktake Purification.description: Gets all the mote records from the currently bound Mote Nexus that match the passed item type or could be combined with the passed mote.

Capacity Reflection.name: mote/storage/remaining_capacity/get
Capacity Reflection.description: Gets the remaining capacity of the bound Mote Nexus.

Containment Distillation.name: mote/storage/contains
Containment Distillation.description: Returns true if the Mote Nexus at the given position contains a mote of the given type, or that would stack with the given mote, and false otherwise.

Mediafy Item.name: mote/make
Mediafy Item.description: Convert an item in the world (either an item entity or an item frame) into a mote on your stack. If passed an existing mote instead adds the items from the entity to the mote. Mediafying an item costs a tenth of an Amethyst Dust.

Return Item.name: mote/return
Return Item.description: Returns all the items from a mote to the world at the location of your choosing. If passed a number returns at most that many items. Costs a tenth of an Amethyst Dust.

Weighing Purification.name: mote/count/get
Weighing Purification.description: Accepts a mote and returns the number of items in the record referenced by that mote.

Stacking Distillation.name: mote/combine
Stacking Distillation.description: Combines two motes into one, merging the mote records they point to. Any pointers to the second mote will become null, any pointers to the first will remain. This can make motes holding many more items than I could carry in a stack naturally!

Stacking Distillation II.name: mote/combinable
Stacking Distillation II.description: Returns true if the first mote can be combined with the items in the second argument (which can be a mote, item entity, or item frame), and false otherwise.

Splitting Gambit.name: mote/split
Splitting Gambit.description: Splits the specified number of items off of the passed mote, creating a new mote pointing to a new mote record.

Depot Purification.name: mote/storage/get
Depot Purification.description: Get the position of the Mote Nexus that contains the passed mote.

Depot Gambit.name: mote/storage/set
Depot Gambit.description: Move the record referenced by the passed mote to the Mote Nexus at the passed position. This returns a new mote pointing to that record, and invalidates all previous motes pointing to that record.

Craft.name: mote/craft
Craft.description: Takes a mote, list of motes, or list of list of motes. returns a list containing the results of crafting with those items. For example, the input Stone x128 would return [Stone Button x128].

Seniority Purification.name: mote/villager/level/get
Seniority Purification.description: Accepts a villager, returns a number representing that villager's seniority and skill at their craft.

Offering Purification.name: mote/trade/get
Offering Purification.description: Accepts a villager and returns all of the trades that villager is offering. This is a list of lists of lists. Each trade comprises two lists, the cost, and the returned items. The returned items is a list containing the type of item, and the number of items.

Trade.name: mote/trade
Trade.description: Accepts a villager, a list of motes to trade with to villager, and optionally an int for which of that villager's trades to attempt. (int? above means that you can pass 2 or 3 arguments, the optional 3rd being an int).

Use Item On.name: mote/use_on
Use Item On.description: Accepts a mote, and either an entity, or a target block and a normal vector. Uses the item on the entity/block. The mote must either only have one item in it, or the items contained must be extremely simple (no NBT data).

Consume Wisp.name: wisp/consume
Consume Wisp.description: Remove a wisp from the stack, and disassemble the wisp. The patterns contained are lost, but the media that it contained can be repurposed if this spell is cast by another wisp.

Bind Wisp.name: wisp/seon/set
Bind Wisp.description: Bind one of my wisps closer to me; I may only have one bound wisp at a time, but whichever wisp is bound costs significantly less upkeep and increased range.

Accelerate.name: tick
Accelerate.description: Causes the block at the passed vector to perform its normal actions faster in the instant that this spell is cast.

Gate's Reflection.name: gate/make
Gate's Reflection.description: Adds a new gate iota to the stack. Any copy of this iota will point to the same numbered gate. Costs 32 Charged Amethyst. If passed null, makes a Drifting Gate. If passed a vector, makes a Location Anchored Gate, If passed a vector and an entity, makes an Entity Anchored Gate.

Phase Block.name: interop/fabric_only/phase_block
Phase Block.description: Takes a position and a number, and phases the block at that position out for that many seconds. Costs one ten-thousandth of an Amethyst Dust times the square of the time to phase out for.

Blank Reflection.name: string/empty
Blank Reflection.description: Add an empty string to the stack, useful for combining with other strings.

Spacing Reflection.name: string/space
Spacing Reflection.description: Add a blank space string to the stack, useful for combining with other strings.

Comma Reflection.name: string/comma
Comma Reflection.description: Add a comma string to the stack, useful for combining with other strings.

Breaking Reflection.name: string/newline
Breaking Reflection.description: Add a string to the stack representing a break between lines, useful for combining with other strings.

Reader's Purification.name: string/block/get
Reader's Purification.description: Removes a vector from the stack. If that vector is pointing at a sign or lectern, it returns that sign or lectern's text to the stack. Otherwise, it returns null.

Write.name: string/block/set
Write.description: Removes a vector and a string from the stack. If that vector is pointing at a sign or lectern, it writes that string to that sign or lectern. Costs a hundredth of an Amethyst Dust.

Whisper Reflection.name: string/chat/caster
Whisper Reflection.description: Adds the last message the caster sent to the stack as a string.

Listener's Reflection.name: string/chat/all
Listener's Reflection.description: Adds the last message anyone sent to the stack as a string.

Sifter's Gambit.name: string/chat/prefix/set
Sifter's Gambit.description: Accepts a string; All future chat messages starting with that string won't be seen by others, and only messages prefixed with that string can be read by Whisper Reflection.

Sifter's Reflection.name: string/chat/prefix/get
Sifter's Reflection.description: Returns the last string you passed to Sifter's Gambit.

Scrivener's Purification.name: string/iota
Scrivener's Purification.description: Converts the iota on top of the stack into a string.

Patternmaster's Purification.name: string/action
Patternmaster's Purification.description: Converts the pattern on top of the stack into the string for that pattern's name. If there is no action associated with that pattern, or if the associated pattern is a Great Spell, it returns null.

Concatenation Distillation.name: string/add
Concatenation Distillation.description: Removes the top two strings from the stack and combines them together.

Separation Distillation.name: string/split
Separation Distillation.description: Removes the top two strings from the stack and splits the first string, using the second string as the delimiter and returning as a list.

Input Purification.name: string/parse
Input Purification.description: Removes a string from the top of the stack and returns the number that string parses as (or null if it doesn't parse).

Discoverer's Distillation.name: string/find
Discoverer's Distillation.description: Removes two strings from the top of the stack, and returns the first index of the first string where the second string is a substring.

Winnowing Distillation.name: string/sub
Winnowing Distillation.description: Removes a string and two positive integers from the top of the stack, and returns the substring from the first to the second (inclusive first, exclusive second).

Length Distillation: Str.name: string/len
Length Distillation: Str.description: Removes a string and returns its length.

Case Distillation.name: string/case
Case Distillation.description: Removes a string and a bool or null. If it was true, return the string in upper case. If false, lowercase. If null, toggle each character's case.

Transformation Purification.name: matrix/make
Transformation Purification.description: Converts the iota on top of the stack into a matrix. This iota can be a number, vector, or list.

Restoration Purification.name: matrix/unmake
Restoration Purification.description: Converts the iota on top of the stack back from a matrix into a number, vector, or list depending on the vector's size.

Identity Purification.name: matrix/identity
Identity Purification.description: Accepts a positive integer n, and returns an n by n matrix with 1 along the diagonal and 0 elsewhere.

Zero Distillation.name: matrix/zero
Zero Distillation.description: Accepts positive integers n and m, and returns an n by m matrix of zeros.

Rotation Distillation.name: matrix/rotation
Rotation Distillation.description: Accepts a vec v and number Î¸, and returns a matrix representing rotating by Î¸ radians around v.

Addition Distillation: Matrix.name: matrix/add
Addition Distillation: Matrix.description: Adds two matrices together; they must have the same number of columns and rows.

Multiplication Distillation: Matrix.name: matrix/mul
Multiplication Distillation: Matrix.description: Multiplies the first n by m matrix with an m by p matrix.

Transpose Purification.name: matrix/transpose
Transpose Purification.description: Accepts an n by m matrix and returns an m by n matrix where every entry has been flipped along the diagonal.

Inverse Purification.name: matrix/inverse
Inverse Purification.description: Accepts an n by n matrix and returns the n by n matrix such that in*out = identity.

Determinant Purification.name: matrix/determinant
Determinant Purification.description: Accepts a square matrix and returns the determinant of that matrix. Mishaps for matrices larger than 4x4.

Tower Distillation.name: matrix/concat/vert
Tower Distillation.description: Accepts an n by m matrix and an n by p matrix and produces an n by (m+p) matrix by putting the first matrix on top of the second.

Sprawling Distillation.name: matrix/concat/hori
Sprawling Distillation.description: Accepts an m by n matrix and a p by n matrix and produces an (m+p) by n matrix by putting the first matrix to the left of the second.

Toppling Gambit.name: matrix/split/vert
Toppling Gambit.description: Accepts an n by m matrix and an int from 0 to n, and returns two matrices created by splitting the input matrix vertically at the inputted int.

Mitosis Gambit.name: matrix/split/hori
Mitosis Gambit.description: Accepts an n by m matrix and an int from 0 to m, and returns two matrices created by splitting the input matrix horizontally at the inputted int.

Progress Gambit.name: page/right
Progress Gambit.description: Turns the spellbook that your are holding one page to the right

Regress Gambit.name: page/left
Regress Gambit.description: Turns the spellbook that your are holding one page to the left

Nadir of Nausea.name: nausea
Nadir of Nausea.description: Inflicts nausea. Base cost is one Amethyst Dust per 4 seconds.

Clerk's Vacant Reflection.name: dict/new
Clerk's Vacant Reflection.description: Pushes a new empty dictionary to the stack

Clerk's Distillation.name: dict/from
Clerk's Distillation.description: Turns two list into a dictionary, same rules apply (invalid keys get their values dropped)

Clerk's Decomposition.name: dict/break
Clerk's Decomposition.description: Breaks a dictionary into list of keys and values

Clerk's Decomposition II.name: dict/break/single
Clerk's Decomposition II.description: Breaks only the first value (and drops the others)

Clerk's Thoths Gambit.name: dict/thoths
Clerk's Thoths Gambit.description: Thoths, but dictionary, pushes key,value to the top of the stack instead of a single value (value highest)

Clerk's Abacus Purification.name: dict/size
Clerk's Abacus Purification.description: consumes a dictionary and return it's size (cannot be more then 32 (default)

Clerk's Integration Exaltation.name: dict/set
Clerk's Integration Exaltation.description: Adds the key/value pair to the dictionary (dictionary remains on stack)

Clerk's Surgeon's Exaltation.name: dict/get
Clerk's Surgeon's Exaltation.description: Gets the value from the dictionary using key (dictionary remains on stack)

Clerk's Excisor's Distillation.name: dict/remove
Clerk's Excisor's Distillation.description: Removes a key from the dictionary (dictionary remains on stack)

Iterators Purification.name: itter
Iterators Purification.description: Takes a number and returns all number 0 to n-1 (produces n values)

Natural Search.name: craft/grandscroll
Natural Search.description: Takes a Ancient Scroll and a Budding amethyst and searches for a random Grand spell

Suspicious Glyph.name: suicide
Suspicious Glyph.description: It appears to be a pattern, I wonder what happens if I cast it

Reroll Pattern.name: grand/reroll
Reroll Pattern.description: takes a Entity (Ancient/Crystallized scroll) and changes the pattern upon it the cost increasing exponentially with the each cast

Mass Mindflay.name: grand/massbrainsweep
Mass Mindflay.description: sacrifices some mobs and performs a ritual using them I cannot cast this by handI have some notes on this

Alidade's Purification II.name: direction/const
Alidade's Purification II.description: Alidade's Purification but it returns the direction player is looking in form of full, round vectors, as (0,1,0).

Visibility Distillation.name: visibility/const
Visibility Distillation.description: Returns whether a vector is currently within vision of an entity.

Inertia Purification.name: is_gravity/const
Inertia Purification.description: Determines whether the entity is currently in a state of inertia or if it is subject to the force of gravity. If the entity is found to be in a state of inertia, purification returns true.

Hadamard's Distillation.name: hadamard/const
Hadamard's Distillation.description: Elements corresponding to the same columns of given vectors are multiplied together to form a new vector.

Sniper's Distillation.name: pixel/raycast
Sniper's Distillation.description: Architect's Distillation but it  returns the precise hit position. Very versatile, it can be used on various entities and materials with the exception of air.

Vehicle Purification.name: get_vehicle/const
Vehicle Purification.description: Pops the entity off the stack and pushes a reference to the vehicle it is currently occupying. Returns Null if the entity is not riding any vehicle.

Jockey Purification.name: get_rider/const
Jockey Purification.description: Pops the entity (vehicle) off the stack and pushes a reference to the entity that is currently occupying it. If vehicle has more than one passenger it returns the first one.

Shooter Purification.name: get_shooter/const
Shooter Purification.description: It pops an object off the stack and pushes out the reference to the entity that fired it. Returns Null if the entity isn't a projectile. Only works if shooter is in your ambit.

Imprecision Purification.name: round/const
Imprecision Purification.description: Number or elements in given vector are rounded to the nearest whole.

Optician's Distillation.name: reflection/const
Optician's Distillation.description: This operation retrieves two vectors from the stack and calculates a vector reflection of the first vector based on the second vector, which acts as a normal and defines the reflection plane.

Sphere Distillation.name: get_vec/const
Sphere Distillation.description: Take a position and maximum distance on the stack, and combine them into a list of all block positions that are needed to create an hollow sphere of that range.

Span Distillation.name: get_vec_from/const
Span Distillation.description: Combine two positions and create a list that includes those points as well as all block positions located between them.

Rotate.name: rotate/spell
Rotate.description: Takes an entity and a vector as inputs and performs a rotation of the entity, to the direction indicated by the vector. It costs 1/8 of amethyst dust or if cast on another player it will cost one amethyst shard.

Rotate II.name: rotate_two/spell
Rotate II.description: Accepts an entity and a vector, rotates the entity motion direction in direction of a vector. If rotated to [0, 0, 0] it will completly stop its velocity. Costs 3/4 amethyst dust.

Rotate: Block.name: rotate_block/spell
Rotate: Block.description: Accepts a vector and a direction vector, rotates block at a given vector. Although it may appear to function similar to explosions, high explosion-resistant blocks are not affected. Costs 1/8 of amethyst dust.

Momentum Swap.name: swap/spell
Momentum Swap.description: Swaps the motion of two entities. Costs 1 amethyst dust.

Lesser Teleport.name: lesser_teleport/spell
Lesser Teleport.description: Takes entity and number or vector off the stack, then teleports the entity to its vector but with all fractions changed to given number, or fractions of every component changed to number in responding component in given vector.

Place Projectile.name: projectile/spell
Place Projectile.description: Remove a location from the stack, then pick a projectile item and place it at the given location. The following items are currently compatible: normal, tipped, and spectral arrows, snowballs, eggs, tridents, ender pearls, eyes of ender, and fire charges. Costs 1 amethyst shard.

Twokai's Ideal Condition.name: zero_g/spell
Twokai's Ideal Condition.description: Makes an entity not affected by gravity or friction for certain amount of time.

Propulsion.name: fast/spell
Propulsion.description: This spell utilizes a vector to impulse a target entity, applying a continuous force over a duration determined by a given number.

Greater Translocation.name: move_block/spell
Greater Translocation.description: This spell lets me teleport almost any block nearly anywhere in the entire world! There does seem to be a limit, but it is much greater than the normal radius of influence I am used to.

Orchard's Reflection.name: read_orchard
Orchard's Reflection.description: Picks a number from my mind's orchard representing the index of my thought.

Orchard's Reflection II.name: read_orchard_list
Orchard's Reflection II.description: Picks values from my orchard as a list.

Terra Reflection.name: in_overworld
Terra Reflection.description: Returns whether or not the entity is in the overworld

Everflame Reflection.name: in_nether
Everflame Reflection.description: Returns whether or not the entity is in the nether

Canary's Purification.name: check_ambit
Canary's Purification.description: Returns whether or not the given entity or position is in ambit

Athena's Gambit.name: catchy_eval
Athena's Gambit.description: Casts the pattern or patterns on the stack similarly to Hermes' Gambit. If its cast mishaps it will continue on instead of stopping the hex. Returns whether or not the cast mishap

Athena's Revelation.name: reveal_mishap
Athena's Revelation.description: Reveals the last mishap. This may behave strangely when cast directly from my staff

Euler's Purification.name: assert
Euler's Purification.description: Asserts that the boolean is true and mishaps if not. The mishap is labeled with whatever pattern, if any, comes before it on the stack

Gloopimind Upload.name: gloopimind_upload
Gloopimind Upload.description: Uploads my gloopifact's ravenmind to my staff

Gloopimind Download.name: gloopimind_download
Gloopimind Download.description: Downloads my staff's ravenmind to my gloopifact

Bind Mirror.name: bind_mirror
Bind Mirror.description: This allows me to bind myself to a Mirrored Pedestal so that its held item is reflected into my empty hand.

Temp Bind Mirror.name: temp_bind_mirror
Temp Bind Mirror.description: Similar to Bind Mirror but only lasting for the single instant of my cast.

Handy Gambit.name: set_hotbar_slot
Handy Gambit.description: Selects the slot indexed by the given number

Handy Reflection.name: get_hotbar_slot
Handy Reflection.description: Returns the index of the currently selected slot

Handoff.name: swap_hotbar_slot
Handoff.description: Swaps my held items between my hands

Torty Transfer.name: torty_transfer
Torty Transfer.args: slot, slot | null, num → num, entity?
Torty Transfer.description: Transfers up to the given number of items from the first slot to the second slot. It returns the number of items left in the input slot. If the second slot is null it drops the items on the caster and pushes a reference of it to the stack.

Torty's Purification.name: torty_count
Torty's Purification.description: Returns how many items are in the given slot.

Torty's Max Purification.name: torty_max_count
Torty's Max Purification.description: Returns how many items can fit in the given slot.

Torty's Reflection.name: torty_inv_sizes
Torty's Reflection.description: Returns a list containing the sizes of every inventory the inventorty can see, sorted based on the inventory index.

Gloopcaster's Reflection.name: gloopifact_read
Gloopcaster's Reflection.description: Reads the iota from the gloopifact's internal focus

Gloopcaster's Gambit.name: gloopifact_write
Gloopcaster's Gambit.description: Writes an iota to the gloopifact's internal focus

Gloopitor's Reflection.name: gloopifact_check_read
Gloopitor's Reflection.description: Returns whether or not the internal focus can be read

Gloopessor's Distillation.name: gloopifact_check_write
Gloopessor's Distillation.description: Returns whether or not the given iota can be written to the internal focus.

Dymo's Gambit.name: set_label
Dymo's Gambit.description: Assigns a label based on the given iota to the currently selected slot of a labelable item in my offhand.

Conjure Tasty Treat.name: conjure_tasty_treat
Conjure Tasty Treat.description: Conjures a thought gummy at the given position. Costs 1 dust.

Merchant's Reflection.name: get_item_bound_caster
Merchant's Reflection.description: Returns the name of whoever wrote the coin in my other hand.

Notary's Purification.name: compare_item_bound_caster
Notary's Purification.description: Takes a player entity and returns whether or not they wrote the coin in my other hand.

Merchant's Purification.name: cooler_get_item_bound_caster
Merchant's Purification.description: Returns the name of whoever wrote the coin in the given item entity.

Notary's Distillation.name: cooler_compare_item_bound_caster
Notary's Distillation.description: Takes a player entity from the top of the stack and an item entity and returns whether or not the player wrote the coin in the item entity.

Acknowledge Truename.name: truename_agree_eula
Acknowledge Truename.description: Recently I've felt worries whenever I write my truename. This spell seems to silence those worries. I can always cast it again if I'd like to be more cautious.

Dispense.name: dispense
Dispense.description: Dispenses the given item entity as if it were in a dispenser at the first position facing the direction given by the second vector.Costs half a dust for most items, 1 charged for arrows, and 3 dust for other projectiles

Frogi Snack.name: frog_eat
Frogi Snack.description: I've seen frogs in a nature try to eat slimes and magma cubes, perhaps my Frogi would like to do the same ?Costs about a shard

Ritualist's Purification.name: block_read
Ritualist's Purification.description: Returns the iota stored by the block at the given position

Ritualist's Gambit.name: block_write
Ritualist's Gambit.description: Stores the given iota in the block at the given position, if possible

Surveyor's Purification.name: can_block_read
Surveyor's Purification.description: Returns whether the given block contains a readable iota

Surveyor's Distillation.name: can_block_write
Surveyor's Distillation.description: Returns if I can store the given iota in the block at the given position.

Cut Stone.name: stonecut
Cut Stone.description: Cuts the given item entity as if it were in a stonecutter. If it's given a number it chooses the cut based on that index in the stonecutter, if it's given an item type it tries to cut it into that type.Costs an 8th of a dust.

Craft Potion.name: craft/potion
Craft Potion.description: Crafts a Casting Potion. Costs about 1 shard.

Forge Hex Blade.name: craft/hex_blade
Forge Hex Blade.description: Similar to other casting instrument creation spells. Costs about 4 Charged Amethyst

Forge Hex Pickaxe.name: craft/hex_pickaxe
Forge Hex Pickaxe.description: Similar to other casting instrument creation spells. Costs about 4 Charged Amethyst

Etho's Purification.name: read_comparator
Etho's Purification.description: Reads the value of the block at the given position as a comparator would

Seth's Purification.name: read_redstone
Seth's Purification.description: Gets the redstone signal strength of the block of at the given position

Conjure Redstone Block.name: conjure_redstone
Conjure Redstone Block.description: Conjures a redstone-like block at the given position and with the given signal strength. The strength is bound between 0 and 15. This costs 1 dust.

Memento's Reflection.name: read_pendant
Memento's Reflection.description: Copy the iota stored in a pendant I'm wearing and add it to the stack

Memento's Gambit.name: write_pendant
Memento's Gambit.description: Remove the top iota from the stack, and save it into the pendant I'm wearing

Cherishing Reflection.name: check_read_pendant
Cherishing Reflection.description: If the pendant I'm wearing holds an iota I can read, returns True. Otherwise, returns False.

Nostalgic Reflection.name: check_write_pendant
Nostalgic Reflection.description: If I could save an iota into the pendant I'm wearing, returns True. Otherwise, returns False.

Anularis Reflection.name: read_ring
Anularis Reflection.description: Copy the iota stored in a ring I'm wearing and add it to the stack. If I'm wearing multiple rings this will prefer the one on the hand opposite the one I'm casting with.

Anularis Gambit.name: write_ring
Anularis Gambit.description: Remove the top iota from the stack, and save it into the ring I'm wearing. If I'm wearing multiple rings this will prefer the one on the hand opposite the one I'm casting with.

Lover's Reflection.name: read_left_ring
Lover's Reflection.description: Copy the iota stored in a ring I'm wearing and add it to the stack. If I'm wearing multiple rings this will prefer the one on my off hand.

Lover's Gambit.name: write_left_ring
Lover's Gambit.description: Remove the top iota from the stack, and save it into the ring I'm wearing. If I'm wearing multiple rings this will prefer the one on my off hand.

Rival's Reflection.name: read_right_ring
Rival's Reflection.description: Copy the iota stored in a ring I'm wearing and add it to the stack. If I'm wearing multiple rings this will prefer the one on my main hand.

Rival's Gambit.name: write_right_ring
Rival's Gambit.description: Remove the top iota from the stack, and save it into the ring I'm wearing. If I'm wearing multiple rings this will prefer the one on my main hand.

Authenicator's Reflection.name: check_read_ring
Authenicator's Reflection.description: If a ring I'm wearing holds an iota I can read, returns True. Otherwise, returns False.

Jeweler's Reflection.name: check_write_ring
Jeweler's Reflection.description: If I could save an iota into a ring I'm wearing, returns True. Otherwise, returns False.

Renew Truename.name: clear_truename
Renew Truename.description: This spell lets me renew my truename, effectively clearing any stored references to it.

Curiosity's Purification.name: torty_get_type
Curiosity's Purification.description: Returns the type of the item in the given slot

Athena's Reflection.name: stringify_mishap
Athena's Reflection.description: Returns a string with information on the last mishap.

Torty's Reflection II.name: torty_inv_names
Torty's Reflection II.description: Returns a list containing the names of every inventory the inventorty can see, sorted based on the inventory index.

Astral Projection.name: astral_projection
Astral Projection.description: Finally, no longer am I confined to my mortal shell! The spell projects my mind outside of my body, granting multiple useful abilities for the specified number of seconds.

Astral Locale Reflection.name: astral_pos
Astral Locale Reflection.description: Returns the "eye" position vector of my astral self, similarly to how Compass' Purification works for my physical body. Returns Null if I am not projecting.

Astral Gaze Reflection.name: astral_look
Astral Gaze Reflection.description: Returns the direction my astral self is looking in, similarly to how Alidade's Purification works for my physical body. Returns Null if I am not projecting.

Etch Visage.name: macula/add
Etch Visage.description: Puts the visage at the specified point in the Macula Space. If the display duration (the third argument) is supplied, the visage is Fleeting, otherwise - Lasting. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Macula Erasure.name: macula/clear
Macula Erasure.description: Clears my Macula quickly and painlessly. Definitely beats suffering a Black Eye or dying. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Macula Gambit.name: macula/dimensions
Macula Gambit.description: Returns my current Macula width and height. An absolute must for any sufficiently complex Macula calculations.

Calligrapher's Purification.name: visage/text/unbounded
Calligrapher's Purification.description: Extracts current display text from any iota and creates an unbounded text visage iota.

Calligrapher's Exaltation.name: visage/text/bounded
Calligrapher's Exaltation.description: Extracts current display text from any iota and creates a bounded text visage iota, with the first number specifying max width and second - max height.

Media Reflection.name: get_media
Media Reflection.description: Returns the amount of media currently available to the hex without overcasting, in units of Amethyst Dust.

Media Purification I.name: get_entity_media
Media Purification I.description: Returns the amount of media in a dropped item entity, or in an entity's inventory if it is a player, in units of Amethyst Dust. Returns 0 if not applicable.

Media Purification II.name: get_pos_media
Media Purification II.description: Returns the total amount of media in the container at the position, in units of Amethyst Dust. Returns 0 if not applicable. Works for a certain special container as well.

Medivh's Reflection.name: cloak/read
Medivh's Reflection.description: Old tales depict a figure of power unmatched, yet tender to all creatures under the sun. Among his many great feats, he was the first to spin the Featherweave Cloak fabric out of feathers and dust.

Spatial Reflection.name: getdim1
Spatial Reflection.description: Returns a Spatial Imprint representing the dimension I am currently in. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Spatial Reflection II.name: getdim2
Spatial Reflection II.description: Returns a Spatial Imprint representing the dimension my sentinel is currently in. Costs a slightly-less-negligible amount of media.

Baton Reflection.name: getrodlook
Baton Reflection.description: When cast with a Reverberation Rod, returns my look vector from when I started the current cast loop.

Baton Reflection II.name: getrodpos
Baton Reflection II.description: When cast with a Reverberation Rod, returns my eye position from when I started the current cast loop.

Metronome Reflection.name: getrodstamp
Metronome Reflection.description: When cast with a Reverberation Rod, returns the timestamp from when I started the current cast loop.

Decorator's Purification.name: readframerotation
Decorator's Purification.description: Accepts an item frame entity, and returns its rotation, from 0 to 7.

Retrieve Idea.name: readidea
Retrieve Idea.description: Accepts a valid key, and returns the corresponding iota. Costs about 1 amethyst dust.

Metadata Purification.name: readideatime
Metadata Purification.description: Accepts a valid key, and returns when the corresponding iota was inscribed, or NULL. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Metadata Distillation.name: readideawriter
Metadata Distillation.description: Accepts a valid key and a player, and returns whether the corresponding iota was inscribed by that player. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Scrutinize Sentinel.name: readsentinel
Scrutinize Sentinel.description: Accepts a vector and a player, and returns either the distance from the vector to the target player's sentinel or NULL. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Discern Shroud.name: detectshroud
Discern Shroud.description: Accepts a vector and a number, and returns a list of unit vectors pointing from the initial vector to shrouded entities within a radius defined by the number.

Apothecary's Prfn..name: getstatus
Apothecary's Prfn..description: Accepts a living entity, and returns a list status iotas representing all effects on the target.

Apothecary's Prfn. II.name: getstatuscategory
Apothecary's Prfn. II.description: Accepts a status effect type, and returns a number based on whether the effect is likely to be helpful, harmful, or neutral to a creature.

Pharmacist's Dstln..name: getstatusduration
Pharmacist's Dstln..description: Accepts an entity and a status effect type, and returns the effect on the target's duration in seconds.

Pharmacist's Dstln. II.name: getstatuslevel
Pharmacist's Dstln. II.description: Accepts an entity and a status effect type, and returns the effect on the target's potency.

Zone Exltn.: Status.name: getbystatus
Zone Exltn.: Status.description: Accepts a status effect type, a vector, and a number (n), and returns a list of entities within radius n of the vector which have that effect.

Zone Exltn.: Not-Status.name: getbystatusinverse
Zone Exltn.: Not-Status.description: Accepts a status effect type, a vector, and a number (n), and returns a list of entities within radius n of the vector which do not have that effect.

Entity Distillation: Status.name: getbystatussingle
Entity Distillation: Status.description: Accepts a status effect type and a vector, and returns an entity at that position which has that effect.

Externalize Pigment.name: paintconjured
Externalize Pigment.description: Accepts a vector and an itemtype representing a pigment. Costs a negligible amount of media if targeting my own block, or 1 Amethyst Dust if not.

Particle Burst.name: particleburst
Particle Burst.description: Accepts two vectors and two numbers, and uses them to define a burst of particles. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Decorator's Gambit.name: setframerotation
Decorator's Gambit.description: Accepts an item frame entity and an integer from 0 to 7, and sets its rotation to the number. Costs a negligible amount of media.

Metronome Gambit.name: delayrod
Metronome Gambit.description: Accepts a positive integer. When cast with a Reverberation Rod, delays the current cast loop's next cast until that many twentieths of a second have passed.

Finale.name: haltrod
Finale.description: When cast with a Reverberation Rod, forcibly halts the current cast loop.

Encore.name: resetrod
Encore.description: Accepts a positive integer. Halts the current cast loop but also reduces the cooldown period from 1 second to ((1/20) * number) seconds. Cooldown due to mishap is unaffected.

Inscribe Idea.name: writeidea
Inscribe Idea.description: Accepts a valid key and any iota, and stores it in the corresponding location. Costs about 1 amethyst dust.

Cleanse Status.name: removestatus
Cleanse Status.description: Accepts an entity and a status effect type, and removes that status effect from the entity. Cost is based on the effect's innate harmfulness, its potency, and its remaining duration.

Conduct Rod.name: craftrod
Conduct Rod.description: Acts just like the spells used to program conventional casting items. Costs 10 Charged Amethyst.

Noetic Gateway.name: dimteleport
Noetic Gateway.description: Accepts an entity and a Spatial Imprint and teleports the entity to its position in the corresponding dimension. Costs 20 Charged Amethyst.

Media Infusion.name: infusemedia
Media Infusion.description: Accepts a vector and infuses media into the corresponding block in order to transmute it. Cost and exact effect vary depending on target.

Spatial Interchange.name: swapspace
Spatial Interchange.description: Accepts two lists of two vectors, to define two cuboids, and a Spatial Imprint. These cuboids must have the exact same dimensions and rotation.

Stealth Shroud.name: resistdetection
Stealth Shroud.description: Accepts a living entity and a number (n), and shields the entity from hex-based detection for n seconds. Costs two amethyst dust per second.

Hidden Sun's Zenith.name: invisibility
Hidden Sun's Zenith.description: I've also discovered a spell which applies normal Invisibility. Functions just like the normal Zeniths, and costs one amethyst dust per three seconds.

Empower Mind Render.name: applymindrender
Empower Mind Render.description: Accepts an item or item frame bearing the Sharpness enchantment, and converts it into Mind Render of the same level. Cost is based on enchantment level, and increases by 50% if the item is a book.

Library Key.name: library
Library Key.description: It started with a crack... A small thing really. I felt a light breeze from it that told me things. I'm now certain that every mind has some form of physical representation. I just need to get there. If only I could push that crack wider...

Visitor's Key.name: visit_library
Visitor's Key.description: I should also keep in mind that this method only seems to work on those like myself. Those of us who have "opened" our minds to the realm around us.

Klein's Chest.name: kleins_chest
Klein's Chest.description: The cost of using this mental storage is an amethyst shard plus a quarter of an amethyst dust per slot filled. It takes a surprisingly large amount of mental energy to recall things that shouldn't be there in the first place.
